derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English tēorian 'fail, come to an end', also 'become physically exhausted', of unknown origin

entry.def: If something tires you or if you tire, you feel that you have used a lot of energy and you want to rest or sleep.

example.ex: If driving tires you, take the train...
example.tran: 如果开车觉得累，就乘火车吧。

example.ex: He tired easily, though he was unable to sleep well at night.
example.tran: 他很容易疲倦，可夜里却睡不好觉。

entry.def: If you tire of something, you no longer wish to do it, because you have become bored of it or unhappy with it.

example.ex: He felt he would never tire of international cricket...
example.tran: 他认为自己永远不会对国际板球赛生厌。

example.ex: Sooner or later he may tire of constantly putting himself last.
example.tran: 迟早他会厌倦总是把自己排在最后。

entry.def: A tire is the same as a tyre .

sentences.sentence: "automobile tires are usually made of rubber and filled with compressed air"

means.word_mean: 1. get tired of something or somebody
2. exhaust or tire through overuse or great strain or stress;

sentences.sentence: "We wore ourselves out on this hike"

Sentence.sentence: He is tired of doing gardening on weekends.
According to Kalpit Shah, some students still use paper and pencil because they have get tired of reading on the iPad.
they have get tired of reading on the iPad.
Doctor, I haven't been able to get enough sleep lately, and I'm too tired to concentrate in class.

sentences.en: The tires of the earliest cars were solid.
sentences.cn: 最早的汽车轮胎是实心的。

jushi.english: One tires easily in hot weather.
The long lecture tired the audience.
jushi.chinese: 这冗长的演说使听众厌倦。
